direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods interact with the underlying iterator to manage the state of the PeekingIterator, but perform different operations (retrieval vs. removal).
Both methods handle the state of the iterator and may throw exceptions based on the state (e.g., IllegalStateException for remove() and NoSuchElementException for peek()).
Both methods handle the state of the iterator and may throw exceptions based on the state (e.g., IllegalStateException for remove() and NoSuchElementException for element()).
The remove() method depends on the state managed by the fill() method, particularly the slotFilled and exhausted flags.
Both methods query the state of the iterator but perform different operations (state check vs. removal).
